name: Layer 1
description: Layer 1s are the foundation level of a blockchain. They are the main chain of the network, where blocks are added and transactions are finalized.

name: Layer 2
description: Layer 2s are off-chain vertical scaling solutions that run on top of Layer 1 blockchains like Ethereum to improve scalability, while maintaining the decentralization and security standards of the Layer 1.

name: Dex
description: Decentralized exchanges, or DEXs, allow users to trade with one another in a permissionless manner and without any intermediaries. As long as someone provides liquidity, anyone can purchase and sell that token on the exchange.

name: Storage
description: Storage protocols allow users to store their data on the blockchain network in a decentralized manner.

name: Gaming
description: Video games that are administered with or built in part using blockchain technology.

name: Wallet
description: A crypto wallet is a way to manage, secure, and use cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum and other digital assets based on a blockchain.

name: NFT
description: Non-fungible tokens, or NFTs, are collectible elements within the Ethereum blockchain that usually follow the ERC-721 or ERC-1155 standard. They represent something unique and therefore are not mutually interchangeable.

name: Audit
description: Blockchain auditing is the process of evaluating a blockchain's security, functionality, and compliance with industry standards.

name: Pow
description: Proof-of-work (PoW) is a blockchain consensus mechanism that incentivizes network validation by rewarding miners for adding computational power and difficulty to the network.

name: Pos
description: Proof-of-stake is a cryptocurrency consensus mechanism for processing transactions and creating new blocks in a blockchain.

name: Metaverse
description: The metaverse refers to a digital world where participants can interact with each other in a shared virtual reality.

name: Lending/Borrowing
description: Protocols that allow users to offer crypto loans by staking their assets in them without the need for a bank account.

name: Defi
description: Decentralized Finance refers to financial services that are built on top of distributed networks with no central intermediaries.

name: Payment
description: Blockchain payment systems are decentralized structures employing blockchain technology to facilitate secure, direct transactions devoid of intermediaries.

name: LSD
description: Liquid Staking Derivative (LSD) Network is an opportunity to connect liquidity to node operators, built on top of the Stakehouse Protocol.

name: Web 3
description: Web3 is a term used to describe the next iteration of the internet, one that is built on blockchain technology and is communally controlled by its users.

name: DAO
description: A decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) is a management structure that uses blockchain technology to automate some aspects of voting and transaction processing.

name: Oracles
description: Oracles are used by protocols in their smart contracts in order to obtain external data.

name: IoT
description: The Internet of Things (IoT) ecosystem consists of interconnected computing devices, with the ability to transfer data over a network without the need for any human interaction.

name: Privacy
description: Privacy coins are cryptocurrencies which allow users to conduct transactions privately and anonymously.
